intro: Hieraciodes montana, commonly known as Alpine hairgrass, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It thrives in rocky and alpine environments, often found in high-altitude meadows and grasslands. The plant has slender, grass-like leaves that are typically covered in fine hairs, giving it a soft,绒-like appearance. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are usually white or pale blue, and it blooms in the summer months. Hieraciodes montana plays an important role in stabilizing soil in its harsh habitat and is a characteristic component of alpine flora.
